newsitem.title: USA: Pacific Chemical completes reverse split.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Chemical completes reverse split.

text.p: Pacific Chemical Inc, formerly known as the Bureau of Electronic Publishing Inc, said it completed a one-for-six reverse stock split.
No fractional shares were issued and shareholders entitled to receive a fractional share will receive a cash payment on a basis of $6.18 a share, the company said in a statement Friday.

As previously announced, the company has substantially discounted its interactive multimedia software business and in January 1997 completed its acquisition of a 51 percent joint venture interest in the second largest purified terephthalic acid (PTA) plant in the People's Republic of China.
PTA is a primary raw material in the manufacture of polyester resin.
Estimated outstanding shares after the reverse stock split are about 14,991,400 with 50,000,000 shares authorized, Pacific Chemical said.
